Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is partly covered with a cream-yellow coloured deposit, the exterior is painted cream with a red-brown band and faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now obscured by a light-brown granular deposit.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393261) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393261)
